Artur Jesslen

Ph.D. Student
University of Freiburg
jesslen@cs.uni-freiburg.de


About Me

I am currently a first-year Ph.D. student at the University of Freiburg. I am part of the Generative Vision and Robust Learning group, lead by Adam Kortylewski.

My research lies at the intersection of Computer Vision, Machine Learning, and Computer Graphics. My main goal is to develop generative vision models that enable to reliably perceive the world. Specifically, I study computer vision from a generative perspective, with the hypothesis that vision systems must develop a causal 3D understanding using an analysis‐by‐synthesis approach. My research has demonstrated that these generative vision models are robust, efficient learners that can simultaneously solve various vision tasks.

News

[May, 2023] I will attend the Generative Modeling Summer School (GeMSS) in Copenhagen, June 26th to 30th.
[Mar, 2023] I will be part of the organization of the 2nd Workshop on Out Of Distribution Generalization in Computer Vision at ICCV 2023.
[Jul, 2022] I will start a Ph.D. at the University of Freiburg as part of the Generative Vision and Robust Learning group and the Computer Vision group.
